intro: Reaumuria sivasica, commonly known as Sivas reaumuria, is a flowering plant species native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Ephedraceae and is characterized by its low-growing, shrub-like structure. The plant features small, green leaves and produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance and xerophytic traits. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
